context.title: BIRT contexts
context.description: Contexts for items identified by Actuate, 09/2013

context.title: New Report Project
context.description: Eclipse requires that all files are organized in a project. Give the project an arbitrary name. To create the project outside your default workspace, deselect the option to use the default location, and browse to a different location.

topic.label: Create a new project

context.title: New Report - Create a new report
context.description: After creating a project or selecting an existing project, create a new report. Select a parent folder from the list of project folders. Specify the file name of the report.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: New Report - Select a report to copy
context.description: Create a report based on a template or start from a blank report.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Data Source - Hive Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define the connection properties for a Hive data source.
Type the URI to access the Hive data source and the login credentials.
Optionally, type one or more Add File statements to add script files to the Hadoop distributed cache. Separate each Add File statement with a semicolon.

context.title: Data Source - POJO Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a POJO data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source.
* Shared Location of Custom POJO Data Set Classes: Type an expression for the location of the JAR file that contains the POJO classes to use as the data source. * Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. * Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Data Source - POJO Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a POJO data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source.
* Shared Location of Custom POJO Data Set Classes: Type an expression for the location of the JAR file that contains the POJO classes to use as the data source. * Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. * Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Choose Class
context.description: Search for and select the POJO class that retrieves the data at run time.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Column Mapping
context.description: Edit the column mapping information or use the current values. You must know the data type of the field or that the method returns. If a method requires parameters, you must also know the parameter data type. Review the parameter mapping for the selected method. To modify the parameter mapping, choose Edit.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Show Sample Data
context.description: Show sample data if the class is not available at design time.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Method Parameter
context.description: Specify a name, value, and data type for the parameter used by the method that returns the data set column.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Column Mapping
context.description: Edit the column mapping information or use the current values. Define a data set column using a method or field in the Java class.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Data Set - POJO
context.description: In POJO Data Set Class Name, specify the POJO class that retrieves the data at run time. Choose Browse to find and select the class. In Application Context Key, use the default key or delete it. This property is optional.

topic.label: Create a new report

context.title: Data Source - Flat File Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define a flat file to provide data to a report. The file provides data as character-separated values, one data row per line.
Type a folder name or browse to an existing folder that contains one or more flat files. Alternatively, type a URI or browse to a URI that contains one or more flat files.
Select the character set used by the flat file.
Select the file style from the following values: * CSV Comma-separated values * SSV Space-separated values * PSV Pipe-separated values * TSV Tab-separated values
BIRT supports the following optional formats: * The first row of the worksheet contains the column names. * The second row of the worksheet contains the data types. Valid data types are: Big Decimal Date Double Integer String Time Timestamp * Use null values for fields if the data row does not contain all the available columns.

context.title: Select Columns
context.description:
Use this page to define the columns in a flat file that provide data to a report.
Select a file using the file filter.
Select the columns to use as data fields.
If the data source specifies that the first row of the file contains the column names, those names appear as the field names. If the second row of the file contains the data types, those data types appear for selected data fields. Correct the field name and data type if the file does not contain that information.

context.title: Data Source - XML Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define an XML file to provide data to a report. The file must contain well-formed XML.
Provide the following information: * The path to the XML file. * Optionally, the path to the XML schema for the XML file. Leave this field blank if no schema is available. * The encoding used in the XML file. Use the default value, Auto, for BIRT to determine the encoding.

context.title: Data Source - Select a Data Source Type or Choose a Connection Profile
context.description: The data source specifies how the report connects to the database, file, or web service to retrieve data.

topic.label: Build a data source

context.title: Data Set
context.description: A data set is a query that specifies which data to retrieve from the data source. Type a name, or part of a name, to filter the list of data sources.

topic.label: Build a data set

context.title: SQL Select Query
context.description: Create the SQL Select query to retrieve data from the data source. Select and join tables. Specify how to sort data, what data to retrieve and group for aggregations, and the criteria for returning aggregate data.

context.title: Data Source Profile
context.description: Specify how to connect the report to a database, file, or web service. The Classic Models data source is preconfigured and ready to use with BIRT.

topic.label: How to specify connection information for a data source

context.title: Excel Data Source
context.description:
Use this page to define an Excel workbook to provide data to a report.
Type a file name or browse to an existing Excel spreadsheet file.
BIRT supports the following optional formats: * The first row of the worksheet contains the column names. * The second row of the worksheet contains the data types.
Valid data types are: Big Decimal Date Double Integer String Time Timestamp

topic.label: How to create an Excel data source

context.title: Select Columns
context.description:
Use this page to define the columns in an Excel workbook that provide data to a report.
Select a worksheet in the Excel workbook.
Select the columns to use as data fields.
If the data source specifies that the first row of the workbook contains the column names, those names appear as the field names. If the second row of the workbook contains the data types, those data types appear for selected data fields. Correct the field name and data type if the workbook does not contain that information.

topic.label: How to specify what data to retrieve from an Excel workbook

context.title: JDBC Data Source Profile
context.description: Specify a driver class, the driver URL, such as jdbc:mysql://localhost/table_name, and the database user name and password. Optionally, specify the URL to the Java Naming and Directory Interface (JNDI) connection pooling service.

topic.label: How to specify connection information for a data source

context.title: Manage JDBC Drivers
context.description: On JAR Files, add a driver in JAR file format. On Drivers, type a URL template, such as jdbc:mysql://localhost/table_name.

topic.label: How to add a JDBC driver

context.title: Query
context.description: Complete the SELECT statement to define an SQL query. Type the entire statement or double-click available items, such as tables and fields, to complete the query definition.

topic.label: Build a data set

context.title: Data Set - Output columns
context.description: Define output columns for data in the scripted data source. A scripted data source is a Java object that contains tabular data, retrieved using JavaScript.

topic.label: How to view and change output columns

context.title: JDBC Drivers
context.description: Specify the JDBC driver properties for display, including a URL template, such as jdbc:mysql://localhost/table_name.

context.title: Data Set - Joint Data Set
context.description: Create a joint data set, which uses data from different data sources or from non-relational data sources.

topic.label: How to join data sets

context.title: Data Source - Data Source
context.description: Follow on-screen prompts, which vary by data source type, to edit the data source.

topic.label: Connecting to a Data Source

context.title: Advanced Bidi Data Source Settings
context.description:
Specify the bi-directional text settings for the metadata and content of the data source.
Alternatively, to perform no interpretation of bi-directional text, select Disable Bidi Transformation.

context.title: Link with Data Source
context.description: Select a data source for the data set. The data source previously defined for the data set is unavailable.

context.title: Link with Data Source
context.description: Select a data source for the data set. The data source previously defined for the data set is unavailable.

context.title: Data Set - Data Set
context.description: Edit or view the following attributes of the data set: - Data Source - Change the data source for the data set. - Output Columns - Review or modify the alias and display name properties of the output columns. - Computed Columns - Add the result of an expression to the data set. - Parameters - Create a data set parameter to filter the result set in a query. At runtime, the data set parameter provides a replacement for the ? parameter marker in the WHERE clause of the query. - Filters - Filter the data set as an alternative to filtering the data source. - Property Binding - Bind the data set parameter to the report parameter. Specify a time limit for the query request. Typically, the report parameter prompts the user for a value and passes it to the data set parameter to use in the query. - Settings - Include all rows in the preview of query results, or limit the number of rows. BIRT ignores this setting when the data set editor preferences specifies fewer rows. - Preview Results - View column names and field values that the query retrieves from the data source.

topic.label: How to view and change output columns
How to add a computed field to a data set
How to define a data set parameter
How to filter data

context.title: Data Source - JDBC Data Source - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a JDBC data source. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Source. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- JDBC Driver Class: Type an expression for the JDBC driver. This driver specifies the brand of database you use. - JDBC Driver URL: Type an expression for the URL for the machine that runs the database. - User Name: Type an expression for the user name you use to access the database. - Password: Type an expression for the Password for the user name. - JNDI URL: Type an expression for the URL for the JNDI name you use to access the database. - Connection Profile Name: Type an expression for the name of the connection profile. - Connection Profile Store URL: Type an expression for the URL to the location of the connection profile store.

context.title: Data Set - JDBC Data Set - Property Binding
context.description:
Use this page to define the run-time attributes of a JDBC data set. Values that you set on this page override the values defined on the other pages of Edit Data Set. You can use JavaScript to build the property binding value, for example, to access the values of report parameters.
- Query Text: Type an expression for the SQL statement for the query. - Query Time Out: Type an expression for the length of time, in seconds, to wait for the query to return the first data row.

context.title: Template
context.description: Create a template to define a straightforward way to use a custom layout and master pages for a suite of reports.

topic.label: Building a Shared Report Development Framework

context.title: Library
context.description: Create a library to store common report elements, such as images and styles. Design libraries for sharing among a suite of reports.

topic.label: Building a Shared Report Development Framework

context.title: Save as
context.description: Save the file by its current name and in its current folder, or specify another file name or location.

context.title: Template Properties
context.description: Specify a template name, and optionally a description. Browse to an image for the template, or choose Finish to accept the default image.

topic.label: Building a Shared Report Development Framework

context.title: Format Builder
context.description: A report parameter value appears unformatted in a prompt when the report runs. Reformat the report parameter value using a predefined format, such as currency, or a custom format.

context.title: Import Values
context.description: Import values from a data set field to display in the list box, combo box, or as radio buttons.

context.title: Style - General Page
context.description: Create a style to apply a set of formats to report elements.

topic.label: How to create a style

context.title: Style - Font Page
context.description: Set the font properties for the style. The user must have the font installed.

context.title: Style - Size Page
context.description: Set the width and height properties for the style.

context.title: Style - Background Page
context.description: Set the cascading style sheet (CSS) background properties for a style.

context.title: Style - Text Block Page
context.description: Set the cascading style sheet (CSS) text block properties for a style.

context.title: Style - Box Page
context.description: Set the cascading style sheet (CSS) box properties for a style.

context.title: Style - Border Page
context.description: Set the cascading style sheet (CSS) border properties for a style.

context.title: Style - Format Number Page
context.description: Set the number formatting for a style.

context.title: Style - Format Date Time Page
context.description: Set the date and time formatting for a style.

context.title: Style - Format String Page
context.description: Set a string format, such as uppercase, for a style.

context.title: Style - Page Break Page
context.description: Set page break properties for a style. In Widows and Orphans, specify the mininum number of lines to display at the top or bottom of a page when a section displays text on multiple pages. In Before, specify if a page break is inserted before the element to which the style is applied. In After, specify if a page break is inserted after the element to which the style is applied.

context.title: Style - Map Page
context.description: Set alternate values for a style to display instead of data as it appears in the database.

context.title: Style - Highlights Page
context.description: Set a formatting rule for a style that defines when and how to change the appearance of an element. Specify a condition, such as row["OrderTotal"] Greater than 50000, and a property, such as color.

topic.label: How to create a formatting rule

context.title: Style - Comments Page
context.description: Type comments that describe the usage of the style.

context.title: Parameter Group
context.description: If you create many parameters, or want the report to prompt for a certain set of parameters, use parameter groups.

context.title: Hyperlink Options
context.description: Define a hyperlink for a data, label, image, or chart element.

topic.label: How to create a hyperlink that uses an internal bookmark
How to create a drill-through hyperlink

context.title: Hyperlink Parameter
context.description: Define a parameter to provide text in the hyperlink.

context.title: Expression Builder
context.description: Create expressions using a combination of constants, controls, functions, literal values, field names, and operators that evaluate to a single value.

topic.label: Writing Expressions

context.title: Parameter
context.description: Define a parameter that prompts a user to provide input when the report runs.

topic.label: Enabling the User to Filter Data

context.title: Cascading Parameter Group
context.description: Define report parameters that have a hierarchical relationship. Use Add to create a new parameter at the end of the hierarchy.

context.title: Cascading Parameter
context.description: Define a report parameter at the end of a hierarchical relationship. For example, first create a parameter on COUNTRY. Then, create a parameter on STATE.

context.title: Image Item
context.description: Specify the location from which to select the image.

topic.label: How to insert a linked image
How to insert an embedded image
How to insert dynamic images

context.title: Table
context.description: Insert a Table element, specifying the data set from which to retrieve data. Specify the number of columns and detail rows.

context.title: Grid
context.description: Insert a Grid element and use the grid to arrange static elements, such as text and images, within a section.

context.title: Text Item
context.description: Edit and format a Text element. Select the formatting type, HTML or Plain. Select the type of HTML tags to use, or select Dynamic Text. Select Dynamic Text to embed an expression in the text.

topic.label: Displaying text

context.title: Group
context.description: Define and configure groups. Grouping data in a report can make the data easier to interpret and use.

topic.label: Group customer data by credit limit

context.title: Select Data Binding
context.description: Bind data columns or expressions to names. Select the appropriate data set and column, and define calculated fields that items inside a list or table can use.

topic.label: Binding data

context.title: Highlight
context.description: First, specify the condition for formatting a report element. Next, specify the formatting. Select from the common conditions or open expression builder and define a condition.

topic.label: How to create a formatting rule

context.title: Preferences - Bidirectional Properties
context.description: Set the default base text direction and design interface orientation for new report designs. To design reports in languages such as English, choose Left to Right. To design reports in languages such as Hebrew, choose Right to Left.

context.title: Preferences - Data Set Editor
context.description: Specify how many rows to retrieve from the data source for previewing query results.

topic.label: How to change the number of rows that appear in Preview Results

context.title: Preferences - Expression Syntax
context.description: Select the default expression syntax to use in the expression builder.

context.title: Preferences - Syntax Coloring
context.description:
Select the colors and text formatting to use for syntax elements in the expression builder.
BIRT displays sample code to illustrate the selections you make.

context.title: Preferences - Bidirectional Properties - JDBC Data Source
context.description: Specify the bidirectional format attributes for data retrieved from a JDBC data source.

context.title: Preferences - Layout
context.description: Select the default unit of measure to use for report item dimensions such as margin, padding, height, and width.

context.title: Preferences - Element Names
context.description: Assign custom default names to elements that you use in your report. Each name you specify appears in the element's Name property on the General properties page of Property Editor. For example, if you assign CustomerReportTable as the default name for the table element, and you insert three tables in the report, the first table's name is CustomerReportTable, the second table's name is CustomerReportTable1, and the third table's name is CustomerReportTable2.

context.title: Preferences - Library
context.description:
Use this page to add or remove libraries.
A BIRT report library is a collection of report components that can be used in a report design. Report components include reusable visual report items, data sources, data sets, parameters, translations and more.
A library is a customizable, pre-defined set of rules that helps a user quickly create a report with a specific look.
A BIRT library includes both formatting information and rules that help you create a report. A library is like a skin for a report; it takes the data, structure, and layout of a report, and applies formatting defined in the library to transform the appearance of the report.
A library can start with a style sheet, a set of common styles to apply to all reports within an application. The library can then add commonly used data sources, reusable components, translated text, images and more.

context.title: Preferences - Preview
context.description: Select a bidirectional text setting to orient text in previews. The Report Designer interface follows the orientation of the text. To preview reports in languages such as English, choose Left to Right. To preview reports in languages such as Hebrew, choose Right to Left. Enable a Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) device renderer for the chart engine.

topic.label: How to preview a report in a different locale

context.title: Preferences - Preview Server
context.description: Specify the BIRT server and port values. The default Tomcat server runs under Eclipse and serves report previews to users.

context.title: Preferences - Template
context.description: By default, BIRT stores templates in a location that is not shared. To share report templates, specify a folder that contains your templates.

topic.label: How to set up a template folder

context.title: Import CSS Styles
context.description: Browse to and select a cascading style sheet (CSS) file. Select styles you want from the list of the reportâ€™s styles. BIRT renames any incompatible style name, lists the unique name, and imports the styles. Notifications appear about any unsupported CSS syntax contained in the file.

topic.label: How to import styles

context.title: Preferences - Comment Template
context.description: Add a boilerplate comment to every report design you create. The comment appears in a report's Comments page under Properties in Property Editor.

context.title: Preferences - Classpath
context.description: If your report uses classes or JAR files, add these objects to the classpath.

context.title: Preferences - Resource
context.description: To share resources with other developers, change the location of resources from your workspace to a shared location. Browse to a shared folder relative to your workspace, or browse the file system. Alternatively, browse Eclipse variables and select a variable that represents a folder, such as eclipse_home.

context.title: Publish Library
context.description: To share a library, publish it to a resource folder. Change the file name and accept the default folder, or browse to a subfolder of the resource folder.

context.title: Browse resource folders
context.description: Choose the arrow to filter the list of resource folders contained in Resource Explorer. Select a resource folder in which to publish the library.

context.title: Report Elements Filter
context.description: Selected items do not appear in the resource folder tree in Browse resource folders.

context.title: Export
context.description: Type a name for the item you want to export to a library, or choose OK to use the default name.

context.title: Template Report Item
context.description: Provide a name for the report item and instructions for the user about how to use the template.

topic.label: How to create a template report item

context.title: Map Rule
context.description: Define rules that map values from a database column to values in a report column. Each map rule contains a condition and a display value. For example, a set of map rules for a gender database column might map the values null, M, and F into display values No data, Male, and Female respectively.

topic.label: How to map values to different display values

context.title: User Properties
context.description: Type a unique name and select a data type to store information, such as state, in any items in a report. User properties can provide indirect access to the JavaScript classes for BIRT event handlers written in Java code.

context.title: Named Expressions
context.description: Give the expression a unique name, such as rowCustomerName. To specify a default value, open the expression builder. Build an expression, such as ["CUSTOMERLASTNAME"] + "," + row["CUSTOMERFIRSTNAME"].

context.title: Property Editor - Localization
context.description: Assign a resource key to a label or text element. Select a key from the list of keys defined in the report's resource file, or create a new key and save it to the resource file.

topic.label: How to assign a resource file to a report
How to assign an existing resource key to a label or text element

context.title: Add Library
context.description: Add a library to the resource folder.

context.title: Add Resource
context.description: Specify the source file by browsing to and selecting a resource, such as a library, an image, or a cascading style sheet (CSS) file. Provide the file name. Browse to and select a shared resource folder if you want to share the resource.

topic.label: How to link a CSS file

context.title: Select Data Binding
context.description: Bind a column to a report element. Select the data set that contains the column. Select the name of a column to bind to the report element. Add an aggregation to define a calculated field for an element contained in a list or table.

topic.label: How to insert images that are stored in a data source
Binding data

context.title: Preferences - JDBC Data Set
context.description: Specify the maximum number of database schemas and tables to display in Available Items on the Query page of the data set editor.

context.title: Preferences - XML Data Set
context.description: Use this page to control the column mapping page.

context.title: Preferences - Crosstab
context.description:
Set options to control the behavior of the cross tab builder.
In Filter Limit, specify the number of values to retrieve from the data source when selecting values for a filter.
In Prompt, select whether to display the informational message about how to create a cross tab element.
You can also choose how the report designer treats unused data bindings after you change the structure of a cross tab.

context.title: Preferences - Report Design
context.description:
Set the appearance of a selected item in the report layout editor.
To display a selected item with an animated highlight, select Enable animated selection.
To display a selected item with a gradient highlight that is not animated, deselect Enable animated selection, then select Enable gradient selection.
To display a selected item with a simple outline with handles, deselect both Enable animated selection and Enable gradient selection.

context.title: Preferences - Data
context.description:
Specify the maximum amount of data that a report displays in the Preview page of the report editor. Reducing any of these values makes the report preview faster. Increasing these values produces a report preview that contains more of the data in your data set.
To display all the rows returned by the data set, select No limits on the number of rows to display. To set the maximum number of rows, type a value in Number of rows to display.
To set the maximum number of rows to display in a group in a table or cross tab, type a value in Member count of each row level to display.
To set the maximum number of columns to display in a horizontal group in a cross tab, type a value in Member count of each column level to display.
To limit the size of a data cube structure in memory, type the number of megabytes in In-memory cube size.

context.title: Dataset Parameter Binding
context.description: Check or change the binding of a parameter to a data set field. Edit the value that a data set parameter uses for the report item.

topic.label: Link the orders subreport to the customers master report

context.title: Insert Element
context.description: Select an element to insert and choose OK.

context.title: Reference Found
context.description: The report item that you selected to delete is used by other items. This list shows items that are dependent on the item you want to delete. If you delete this item, remove the dependencies before attempting to run the report.

context.title: Dimension Builder
context.description: In Measure, type the size of the property that you selected to edit. In Units, select the unit of measure for the size.

context.title: Derived Measure
context.description:
A derived measure gets its values from an expression rather than a column in the data cube.
In Name, type a unique name for the derived measure. In Data Type, select an appropriate data type, such as Float or Integer. In Expression, type an expression that uses column bindings defined in the cross tab, or use the expression builder.

context.title: Class Selection
context.description: Choose an event handler from the list of applicable event handlers.

context.title: Browse Resource Files
context.description: Select a resource file from the available list of resource files in the BIRT resource folder.

topic.label: How to assign a resource file to a report

context.title: Browse Resource Files
context.description: Select a JAR file from the BIRT resource folder.

context.title: Browse Resource Files
context.description: Select a JavaScript file from the BIRT resource folder.

context.title: Browse Resource Files
context.description: Select a properties file from the BIRT resource folder.

context.title: Data Binding
context.description: Bind an expression to the selected Data element. Specify a unique display name, a data type, such as String, and an expression, such as new Date().

topic.label: Binding data
How to create a column binding

context.title: Data Item
context.description: Specify a unique display name, a data type, and an expression that specifies an operation on the data item.

topic.label: How to create a column binding

context.title: Computed Column/Filter/Parameter
context.description:
Set or modify a property of a data set.
To create a computed column, provide an arbitrary name and a data type. Specify how to compute the column using an aggregation function or an expression, or both. Specify any filtering required for the computation.
To create a filter, select a column or build an expression that specifies the data to filter. Select a conditional operator and values for the operation. Use this type of filter when the data source does not support filtering in the query.
To create a parameter to filter the results of a query, provide a name, data type, and direction. Direction can be Input, Output, or Input/Output. Only stored procedures support Output and Input/Output. Provide a default value for the parameter or link it to a report parameter.

topic.label: How to add a computed field to a data set

context.title: Data Set Parameter Binding
context.description:
Open expression builder and build an expression that defines the query for the data set parameter
BIRT supports two types of parameters, report and data set. You typically define both types in master-detail report design. One query defines a report parameter. Another defines a data set operation that uses results of the first query at run time.

topic.label: Link the orders subreport to the customers master report

context.title: Parameter
context.description: Type a name for the data set parameter and select a data type. Select the direction of the parameter, Input, Input/Output, or Output. Type a default value or provide an expression for the default value. Select an existing report parameter or create a new report parameter to provide a value to the data set parameter when the report runs.

context.title: Output Column
context.description: Add an alias or display name for a column. BIRT displays the alias in Expression Builder and the display name in Data Explorer, a data element, and the column headings of a table. Optionally, specify a display name ID to specify the resource key.

context.title: Computed Column
context.description: Type a name for the computed column and select a data type. Specify how to compute the column using an expression and, optionally, an aggregation function. Optionally, specify filtering for an aggregation.

context.title: Sort Key
context.description: Create or edit a sort key for this report element. In Key, select a data field on which to sort. Alternatively, open expression builder and create a sorting condition. Specify the sorting direction, the locale, and sort strength or type.

topic.label: Sort the data

context.title: Filter Condition
context.description: To specify the data to retrieve from the data source, open expression builder and build a filter condition. Alternatively, select a data field, a conditional operator, such as Between, and values for the operation.

topic.label: How to filter data

context.title: Select Value
context.description: Select a value to filter the data set displayed by the list or table.

context.title: Thumbnail Builder
context.description: Generate a thumbnail that resembles the report, browse to a thumbnail on the file system, or use a thumbnail in the resource folder.

topic.label: How to publish a template

context.title: Select an Image File
context.description: Select a thumbnail in the resource folder. The thumbnail appears in the New Report Wizard when a report developer uses a published template to create a report design.

topic.label: How to publish a template

context.title: New Selection Choice
context.description: Specify the display text and value of the parameter.

context.title: Select Value
context.description: Select the default value of the parameter. To change the order of the list of available values from ascending to descending, click Select Value.

context.title: Data Set Selection
context.description: Select the primary data set to use for summary categories.

topic.label: Set up data for the cross tab

context.title: Add Group
context.description: Type a descriptive name for the group.

topic.label: Set up data for the cross tab

context.title: Add Summary Field
context.description: Type a descriptive name for the summary field.

topic.label: Set up data for the cross tab

context.title: Link Groups
context.description: Create a group link between multiple data sets used by a cube.

context.title: Edit Group Level
context.description:
To specify user-defined values for row and column headings for this dimension, choose Static. To specify values from the data source for row and column headings, choose Dynamic.
To provide additional information about a group, add attributes by choosing Add. To edit or remove an attribute, select the attribute. Then, choose Edit or Remove respectively.

topic.label: Set up data for the cross tab

context.title: Edit Level Attribute
context.description: Select a field that provides extra information about the group member. For example, if the group is a product code, using the product name as an attribute enables the cross-tab developer to display the name to the user.

context.title: Edit Level Attribute
context.description: Type a value that provides extra information about the group member. Then, type a condition expression to specify the value of the group member to which the attribute applies. For example, a static set of group values, RED, YELLOW, and GREEN could have an attribute that displays DANGER, WARNING, and SAFE respectively.

context.title: Summary Field Properties
context.description: Edit the properties of the summary field. When you drag an item from Available Fields to create a new summary field, the cube builder uses default values for the summary field's name, aggregate function, data type, and expression. You can change any of these values.

context.title: Subtotal
context.description: Add a subtotal to a row or column in a cross tab, or edit an existing subtotal. Specify a data field and an aggregate function.

topic.label: Add grand totals

context.title: Grand Total
context.description: Add a grand total to a row or column in a cross tab, or edit an existing grand total. Specify a data field whose values to sum.

context.title: Page Break
context.description: Add a page break before or after a group level in the cross tab. Alternatively, add a page break after a fixed number of columns in a group by typing a value in Page Break Interval.

context.title: Filter Condition
context.description: Create or edit a filter condition to limit the data that the cross tab displays. You can filter on any dimension (group), dimension level, or measure.

topic.label: How to filter data at the cross tab level

context.title: sort Key
context.description: Create or edit a sort condition to sort the cross tab data in a different order.

context.title: Select Value
context.description: Select a value from the list to filter the cross tab group.

context.title: Show/Hide Measures
context.description: Show or hide measures in the crosstab. You can display a measure as a chart or as text.

context.title: Show Hide Group Level
context.description: Select the dimension levels to display or hide. You can skip levels. For example, if there are three levels, you can display the first and the third levels and skip the second.

context.title: Totals
context.description: To hide or display sums, deselect or select subtotals and grand totals in the cross tab. To show sums as text or as a chart, click a row. From the drop-down menu, make a selection. To specify the position of the sum relative to other members in a group, click the sum. From the drop-down menu, select Before or After.

context.title: Group Level
context.description: Select the group levels to include in the cube.

context.title: Groups and Summaries Page
context.description: To create a dimension, drag a field into Groups. A cross tab can use groups to arrange columns or rows. To create a hierarchy of dimensions in a group, drag multiple fields into the same group. For example, create a hierarchy of COUNTRY, then STATE. To create a summary, drag a field into Summary Fields. A cross tab can use summary fields to display data values in cells.

topic.label: Set up data for the cross tab

context.title: Edit Date Level
context.description: Edit the properties of the date group.

context.title: Filter
context.description: Create, edit, or delete a filter that limits the data rows that the cube uses.

context.title: Add CSS File
context.description: Add a cascading style sheet (CSS) file as a resource. - Type a file name or browse to an existing CSS file. - Accept the default or type a new name to save the file in the project. - Browse to a folder to save the CSS file.

topic.label: How to link a CSS file

context.title: Publish CSS File
context.description: Publish a cascading style sheet (CSS) file to the resource folder.

context.title: Use CSS
context.description: Select a cascading style sheet (CSS) file from the list of CSS styles. If your selection includes any CSS styles that are invalid in BIRT, a notification appears.

topic.label: How to link a CSS file

context.title: Variable
context.description:
Use a variable to store a value from an expression or a data field for later use in the report.
Provide a unique name for the variable. Type an expression or use the expression builder to set the initial value of the variable.
For more information about using variables, use a web browser to go to: http://www.eclipse.org/birt/phoenix/project/notable2.5.php#jump_4

topic.label: Page-level variables and events

context.title: Insert Variable
context.description:
A variable stores a value from an expression or a data field for use in the page header or footer.
For more information about using variables, use a web browser to go to: http://www.eclipse.org/birt/phoenix/project/notable2.5.php#jump_4

topic.label: Page-level variables and events

context.title: Rename Input
context.description: Type a new name for the element. Use any alphanumeric, space, and punctuation characters, except any of the following characters: Backslash (\) Comma (,) Exclamation point (!) Period (.) Semicolon (;) Slash (/)

context.title: New Theme
context.description: Specify a name for the theme. A theme is a collection of styles.

context.title: Relative Time Period Aggregation Builder
context.description: Specify the properties of the relative time period measure. Cross tabs support relative time periods, such as current month, previous month, year-to-date, quarter-to-date, trailing 30 days, and so on.

topic.label: How to aggregate data by a relative time period
